content:
It sounds like you've been busy with dance classes and stagehand work! It's great that you're committed to preparing for your role as Mary Sunshine in "Chicago". Your experience as a stagehand for "The Glass Menagerie" will definitely come in handy, especially with regards to understanding the behind-the-scenes aspects of a production.

As a stagehand, you likely developed important skills such as:

1. **Attention to detail**: As a stagehand, you had to ensure that every detail was in place, from setting up the set to arranging props. This attention to detail will serve you well in your role as Mary Sunshine, where you'll need to focus on perfecting your dance technique and character portrayal.
2. **Time management**: With rehearsals from 7 pm to 10 pm, you had to manage your time effectively to get everything done. This skill will be useful in "Chicago", where you'll need to balance your dance rehearsals, costume fittings, and other responsibilities.
3. **Teamwork**: As a stagehand, you worked with a team to bring the production together. In "Chicago", you'll be working with a cast and crew to create a cohesive and engaging performance.
4. **Adaptability**: Things don't always go as planned in theater, and as a stagehand, you likely had to adapt to last-minute changes or unexpected issues. This flexibility will serve you well in "Chicago", where you may need to make adjustments to your performance or respond to unexpected challenges.

Now, let's talk about your dance classes! It's great that you're taking jazz classes to prepare for the "Nowadays" number. Jazz dance is a high-energy style that requires strength, flexibility, and coordination. Here are some tips to help you improve your jazz technique:

1. **Focus on your core strength**: A strong core is essential for jazz dance, as it helps you maintain control and stability.
2. **Practice your kicks and leaps**: The "Nowadays" number features high-energy kicks and leaps, so make sure to practice these movements regularly.
3. **Work on your turns and pirouettes**: Turning is a fundamental element of jazz dance, so practice your turns and pirouettes to improve your technique.
4. **Play with dynamics**: Jazz dance is all about contrast, so experiment with different dynamics (such as sharp vs. soft, fast vs. slow) to add expression and energy to your movements.

Remember to stay focused, work hard, and have fun! You've got this, and I'm sure you'll shine as Mary Sunshine in "Chicago"!
